DOC.detailed_description: Community Supported Agriculture ( CSA ) innovative approach increase consumer access consumption fresh produce , thereby lower obesity prevalence . However , CSA `` share '' cost may barrier low-income household child . This multistate study examine whether subsidize cost CSAs , integrate tailored education : 1 ) increase consumption fruit vegetable , 2 ) substitute fruits vegetable energy-dense food , 3 ) improve overall diet quality energy balance , thus help child maintain healthy body weight . It also investigate cost-offset CSAs ( `` CO-CSAs '' ) contribute local agricultural economy . Given well-documented risk obesity limited access fresh produce among low-income individual , household target intervention four geographically-diverse state : Vermont , New York , North Carolina Washington .
